case_title: GUL KHATOON vs Haji MUHAMMAD ASLAM and 13 others
respondant: SHO PS New Sariab Quetta (Respondent No. 12)
complaint_summary: Petitioner alleged that her daughter Mst. Khadija was abducted by respondents Nos. 1 to 11 at gunpoint and kept at an unknown location. She sought production of her daughter and registration of FIR against the respondents.
investigation_summary: Police failed to locate the abductee and private respondents for several months. Progress reports were submitted by the Advocate General. The abductee later appeared before the Judicial Magistrate and stated she was not abducted but married Abdul Rehman of her own free will.
judgment_summary: The court found that Mst. Khadija, an adult sui juris Muslim woman, married Abdul Rehman voluntarily. Her allegations of abduction were deemed baseless. The petition was dismissed.
legal_arguments: Sui juris Muslim females can marry without guardian consent.
Marriage not invalid under Child Marriage Restraint Act, 1929.
Reliance on case law: Hafiz Abdul Waheed v. Mrs. Asma Jehangir, PLD 2004 SC 219.

witness_statement.Mst. Khadija: Stated before Judicial Magistrate and the court that she married Abdul Rehman of her own free will and was not abducted.

key_issues: Validity of marriage without guardian consent for sui juris Muslim female

maxims.Sui juris: A person of full age and capacity possessing full social and civil rights.

words_and_phrases.Sui juris: Independent, of full age and capacity.

summary_vector_notes: Petition dismissed as allegations of abduction were found baseless. Abductee confirmed voluntary marriage with Abdul Rehman. Court upheld rights of sui juris Muslim females to marry without guardian consent.

facts.allegations: Abduction of Mst. Khadija by private respondents on gunpoint and failure to register F.I.R. due to police influence.
facts.petition_prayer: Production of abductee and registration of F.I.R. against respondents Nos. 1 to 11.

findings.abductee_statement: Mst. Khadija stated she was not abducted and married Abdul Rehman with her free will and consent.

legal_basis.concept_of_wali: Consent of Wali not required for sui juris Muslim female.

conclusion: The abductee is an adult sui juris Muslim female who exercised her social and civil rights to marry Abdul Rehman of her own free will. Allegations of abduction are baseless. Petition dismissed with no orders as to cost.
